title: Sentinel-2C to Vega and orbit – fit-check to liftoff timelapse
summary: From the arrival of Earth-obversation satellite Sentinel-2C in July 2024 and the first fit-check  to launch on the from Europe’s Spaceport in French Guiana, this timelapse shows how the third Sentinel 2 satellite was prepared for launch. The last Vega rocket, flight VV24, lifted off on 5 September at 03:50 CEST (4 September 22:50 local time).

title: SpaceX Concludes ESA Contract With Second Galileo Mission
summary: SpaceX launched the second of two flights contracted by the European Space Agency to deliver four satellites to orbit for the European Union’s Galileo satellite navigation system. The four Galileo satellites launched aboard SpaceX Falcon 9 missions had initially been assigned to Soyuz flights launched from Europe’s Guiana Space Centre. However, following Russia’s invasion of […]

title: NASA selects Intuitive Machines for lunar communications and navigation services
summary: Intuitive Machines has won a NASA contract worth up to $4.8 billion to provide communications and navigation services at the moon to support the Artemis lunar exploration campaign.

title: ESA seeks better coordination of European space spending
summary: PARIS — The head of the European Space Agency wants better coordination of overall public spending on space in Europe, echoing the recommendations of a recent report. Speaking at the […]

title: Lockheed Martin wins contract to supply geostationary lightning mappers
summary: PARIS – Lockheed Martin won a $297.1 million contract to develop lightning mappers for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s future geostationary constellation. The contract announced Sept. 17 directs Lockheed […]

title: French Rocket Builder Sirius Space Secures Launch Pad in Australia
summary: French rocket builder Sirius Space Services has signed an agreement with Equatorial Launch Australia (ELA) to secure a launch facility at the company’s Arnhem Space Centre in Australia. Sirius Space was founded in 2020 and is developing a range of three rockets that will be capable of delivering payloads of between 175 and 1,100 kilograms […]

title: FAA fines SpaceX for launch license violations
summary: The FAA announced its intent to fine SpaceX more than $633,000 for violating its launch licenses on two occasions in 2023, a decision SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said he will fight in court.

title: Rivada says Lockheed deal boosts investor confidence in constellation
summary: Rivada Space Networks CEO Declan Ganley said Sept. 17 the sale of satellite supplier Terran Orbital to Lockheed Martin is a “real confidence builder” for the operator’s investors, while remaining guarded about financing the multi-billion-dollar constellation.

title: Space Force chief urges readiness for new era of competition
summary: Saltzman pointed to initiatives like the establishment of the Space Futures Command and enhancements in training programs as steps toward building a more agile and effective force

title: Measuring Moon Dust to Fight Air Pollution
summary: Moon dust, or regolith, isn’t like the particles on Earth that collect on bookshelves or tabletops – it’s abrasive and it clings to everything. Throughout NASA’s Apollo missions to the Moon, regolith posed a challenge to astronauts and valuable space hardware. During the Apollo 17 mission, astronaut Harrison Schmitt described his reaction to breathing in […]
